intro: Heracleum polyadenum, commonly known as the lesser cowparsnip, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its large, umbrella-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows up to 1.5 meters tall, with hollow, ridged stems and broad, lobed leaves. Its flowers are small and greenish-yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, oval fruits known as schizocarps. The plant is often found in moist meadows and along riverbanks, and it has some medicinal uses in traditional herbal remedies.
